property.name: application_name
property.label: Application Name
property.description: An Elastic Beanstalk application is a logical collection of Elastic Beanstalk components, including environments, versions, and environment configurations. In Elastic Beanstalk an application is conceptually similar to a folder.

property.name: environment_name
property.label: Environment Name
property.description: An environment is a version that is deployed onto AWS resources. Each environment runs only a single application version at a time.

property.name: solution_stack_name
property.label: Solution Stack Name
property.description: The name of the SolutionStack deployed with this environment

property.name: s3_bucket_name
property.label: S3 Bucket Name
property.description: The name of the S3 bucket where the applications are uploaded

property.name: cname_prefix
property.label: CNAME Prefix
property.description: If specified, the environment attempts to use this value as the prefix for the CNAME. If not specified, the CNAME is generated automatically by appending a random alphanumeric string to the environment name.

property.name: tier_name
property.label: Tier Name
property.description: The name of this environment tier

property.name: tier_type
property.label: Tier Type
property.description: The type of this environment tier

property.name: tier_version
property.label: Tier Version
property.description: The version of this environment tier

property.name: env_tags
property.label: Tags
property.description: This specifies the tags applied to resources in the environment.

property.name: subnets
property.description: The IDs of the Auto Scaling group subnet or subnets. If you have multiple subnets, specify the value as a single comma-delimited string of subnet IDs (for example, 'subnet-11111111,subnet-22222222').

property.name: elbSubnets
property.description: The IDs of the subnet or subnets for the elastic load balancer. If you have multiple subnets, specify the value as a single comma-delimited string of subnet IDs (for example, 'subnet-11111111,subnet-22222222').

property.name: elbScheme
property.description: Specify 'internal' if you want to create an internal load balancer in your VPC so that your Elastic Beanstalk application cannot be accessed from outside your VPC.

property.name: dbSubnets
property.description: Contains the IDs of the database subnets. This is only used if you want to add an Amazon RDS DB Instance as part of your application. If you have multiple subnets, specify the value as a single comma-delimited string of subnet IDs (for example, 'subnet-11111111,subnet-22222222').

property.name: associatePublicIpAddress
property.description: Specifies whether to launch instances with public IP addresses in your VPC. Instances with public IP addresses do not require a NAT device to communicate with the Internet. You must set the value to true if you want to include your load balancer and instances in a single public subnet. Valid values 'true' or 'false'.

property.name: bundle_version
property.description: Logical version for the application bundle. Defaults to application version if empty.
